definition: capacity for liquor/how much one can drink
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Two idiots did not have a lot of capacity for liquor crying at the row finally.
sentences.chinese: 没有酒量的两个傻瓜，最后在巷口抱头痛哭。

sentences.english: My good capacity for brandy, be toughens that time.
sentences.chinese: 我的好酒量，就是那个时候锻炼出来的。

sentences.english: I get a buzz on a mere glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 我只喝一杯就会醉，酒量小。

sentences.english: There are personal, called, , drink only 2 liters.
sentences.chinese: 群臣中有个人叫韦曜，酒量只有二升。

sentences.english: You can't hold your drink, that's your problem. Two beers and you're under the table.

sentences.english: Drink kif you want but please hold your liquor.
sentences.chinese: 可以喝酒但请控制酒量。

sentences.english: The lady seldom has this pleasure, yet excuse this princess have already had no capacity as alcohol to reserve enterprise with.

sentences.english: The French's capacity for liquor also is in decrescent.
sentences.chinese: 法国人的酒量也在变小。

sentences.english: You can't hold your drink, that's your problem.
sentences.chinese: 你的问题是酒量不行，两杯啤酒下肚你就醉了。

sentences.english: Moderate alcohol consumption is associated with the increasing of serum high-density lipoprotein levels and may have a beneficial effect.
sentences.chinese: 饮酒对血脂代谢的影响主要与饮酒量有关。

never to touch a drop of alcohol
